title.narrative: OUTPUT 2.2 MIDCH: PREVENTION OF VIOLENCE AND ABUSE IN HOME AND SCHOOL SETTINGS

description.narrative: 2.2 By 2022, children and families have capacity to prevent violence and abuse in home and school settings.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 2.2 By 2022, children and families have capacity to prevent violence and abuse in home and school settings.

description.narrative: In 2020, UNICEF's technical and financial support contributed to piloting and demonstrating the effectiveness of the locally adapted PATHS life skills programme in modifying behaviours that drive violence, including bullying. This was complimented by efforts to generate new evidence on issues of violence, specifically the prevalence of bullying, and giving parents the tools they need to use more positive disciplining approaches rather than corporal punishment. These initiatives all fall under the newly adopted National Partnership to End Violence Against Children action plan, designed and advocated for by UNICEF. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:25/08/2020

title.narrative: Country has a functioning, national, multi-sectoral, multi-stakeholder coordination mechanism tasked with overseeing national plans or strategies to prevent and respond to violence against children and adolescents, with child and adolescent participation

target.value: 2020:Functional multi-sectoral committee established to prevent violence against children under the National Child Protection Committee

actual.value: 2019:Yes - The National Action Plan of the NPEVAC was adopted by the Ministry of Women and Child Affairs in 2019.
